column5: Go with the 4.6L, for the difference in fuel economy you'll get a much stronger engine. My Tritons 12yrs. old, 4.6L with a 5spd. The 4.2L had some gasket problems.
I use to have a Ford but that was before I had a job...LOL...  TUNDRA is now my sweet ride.......
It CERTAINLY does get better than that and as a matter of fact, MUCH better......(see below)  This is one SWEET RIDE..... and pulls like a mule....
fords are for people who like to work on their cars a lot.

I take offence to that post. My 12yr. old girl's been great!!!! Oil, tires, brakes....just standard maintenance. Most parts manufacturers make parts for both Toyota and Ford. Toyotas may be assembled in Texas, but they are still Japanese to me. Built Ford tough for me!!!
and it starts!

pulls like a mule and waste more fuel than the exxon valdez,Toys first attempt at a fullsize hats off to themthey have lots to learn,dont try your crap with me Bob the Boss has one and we USE it ,an F250 would tear your Sweet toy in half
I can always count on you Bob to stir up a truck thread!!!!   hahaha  Brian, 60k for that Ford is insane..  That's getting into the big 3 diesel price range...
That thing got a HEMI in it?  http://adaptivestrategies.com/Z3-BELLFOLWE...M-RumbleBee.jpg  http://www.cartype.com/pics/1610/full/dodge_rumble_bee_2.jpg
Bring it on.......own one first then post.......I have had the Fix Or Repair Daily trucks and the trucks built by Government Motors and that exactly why I am now a proud owner of a TUNDRA.....
America..Love it or Leave it!
Like many Toy owners your heads so far up your ass you wouldent say anything bad about your overpriced overrated pig on fuel anyhow ,time will tell
i just bought this yesterday. 0% financing too!
Cute! Wait'll it grows up!
Heading out Thursday and going to to see.

Great choice! Enjoy & remember to DICKER!!!   (I want this..  http://toronto.kijiji.ca/c-cars-vehicles-c...QAdIdZ149836317  )
From the title I thought you might be getting serious about a girl.  Why would you want a truck with mud on it that you can't wash off?

Now, now Brian, I realize that as we get older, sometimes we regress a bit to our younger years and get things more fit for a "young" person.  you can't retrieve your youth and beauty sleep doesn't work.
Well thats just drop dead sexy!
Looks to be an awsome truck.I was actually reading up quite a bit on this truck yesterday. Enjoy your off roading, now I wonder if they will let you test drive it off road
Does is come with CAA
If you want to scare youself away from it look at the fuel consumption specs.
a painter must have owned it and splashed some black paint on it....I guess they will discount it for that

I think if you wait a bit the raptor will come with fords new 6.1 liter engine.  Pretty serious offroad potential from a stock pick up.  Lots of susp travel and comes with 35" tires. Have yet to see one on the road.  Pretty $$ though
Never buy a truck with a 4 letter word n it's grill....    Art

A least you don't have to be worried about it getting stolen. It's a Ford  . Thats why I own one. Mines an FX4 off road crew and it has a 5.4 Triton. It gets between 20 to 21 MILES to the GALLON on the HWY which I figure is not bad, city I don't want to know  . I try and keep it 2000 or under rpm. on the HWY. I wish I'd went the 4X4, a little softer ride. But a heads up on the tires price, I have the 18" $350.00   each compare to the 16" $130.00. Good luck on your new ride.
Ford said they would have one on the lot,come September.  As for the price,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,  60-72,000 dollars.  Im back to looking at the smaller ones.LOL

Have the XLT supercrew 18" wheels......and im coming up on a need for tires. A little tip. Dont forget that free full size spare under the bed of the truck LOL. Ill be buying 3 and using the freebee underneath and having one of the old ones put back underneath as a spare.
way to keep your finger on the pulse of the economy ford LOL  Fear Of Recession? Dont think so
Blaque That's exactly what I did. Thanks for the tip anyway, may help someone else.
Seriously??? For a pick up?? I'd be afraid to drive it let alone haul anything with it!!
That's a joke, right?
have ya looked at a  F150 Lariet crew or a SD Lariet  lately, a new loaded Silverado,55K is the norm,once they get the first scratch or dent its all downhill from there anyhow
oh ya drive through the bush with that truck listening to the branches slide across the side of the truck, it would make a grown man cry!
Go with the F250 Super Duty FX4 XLT 5.4L gas burner Brian!!!... It don't get no better than that!!!
Still trying to figure out why.there are so many Triton,s on the used lot?  I want the 6 ,4.2. Manual or auto. prefer the manual.
